sections.content: Numismatic content serves collectors and enthusiasts—coin hunting, grading explanations, collection showcases, and market analysis. Viewers need to see coin details clearly: mint marks, wear patterns, and luster. Macro photography skills are essential. Here's what coin YouTubers use.

sections.title: Coin Content Tips
content: Coin roll hunting videos are popular

faq.question: Best macro setup for coins?
faq.answer: True macro lens (60mm-100mm) ideal. Extension tubes on normal lens work for budget. Copy stand provides stability. 1:1 magnification shows all details. Higher than 1:1 for mint marks.

faq.question: How to light coins properly?
faq.answer: Angled light shows relief and luster—experiment with angles. Axial lighting (through half-mirror) reduces shadows. Ring lights give even illumination. Multiple small lights offer flexibility. Dark background makes coins stand out.

faq.question: Handling coins on camera?
faq.answer: Always use gloves—white cotton or nitrile. Hold by edges only. Demonstrate proper handling as education. Keep coins in holders when possible. Never clean coins on camera (controversial topic).

faq.question: What coin content performs well?
faq.answer: Coin roll hunting very popular—the hunt is entertaining. Error coin discoveries drive excitement. Grading explanations help beginners. Market updates for investors. Rare coin showcases for aspirational content.
